sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The Christian doctrin [sic] and society of the people called Quakers; cleared from the reproach of the late division of a few in some part of America, as not being justly chargeable upon the body of the said people there or elsewhere. Whitehead, George, 1636?-1723.
[2], 20 p.
Printed for Thomas Northcott ..., London, : 1693.
Signed on p. 20: George Whitehead, Ambrose Rigg, William Fallowfield, James Parke, Charles Marshall, John Bowater, John Vaughton, William Bingley. Imperfect: cropped and stained. Reproduction of original in: Friends' Library (London, England).
=======
The Christian doctrin [sic] and society of the people called Quakers; cleared from the reproach of the late division of a few in some part of America, as not being justly chargeable upon the body of the said people there or elsewhere. Whitehead, George, 1636?-1723.
[2], 20 p.
Printed for Thomas Northcott ..., London, : 1693.
Signed on p. 20: George Whitehead, Ambrose Rigg, William Fallowfield, James Parke, Charles Marshall, John Bowater, John Vaughton, William Bingley. Imperfect: cropped and stained. Reproduction of original in: Friends' Library (London, England).
Thomas Northcott
>>>>>>> imprintparse
